block.p: Susan Ann Adams and Charles Grattan Baldwin were married yesterday at the Haddam Neck (Conn.) Congregational Church. The Rev. Dr. Mary Klaaren performed the ceremony.

Ms. Adams, 34, is keeping her name. She manages promotional programs for corporations for Pegasus International, a management consulting company. She graduated magna cum laude from Fordham University.
Susan Ann Adams and Charles Grattan Baldwin were married yesterday at the Haddam Neck (Conn.) Congregational Church. The Rev. Dr. Mary Klaaren performed the ceremony.

Ms. Adams, 34, is keeping her name. She manages promotional programs for corporations for Pegasus International, a management consulting company. She graduated magna cum laude from Fordham University.

She is the daughter of Jane Grant Adams of Rockville, Md., a staff lawyer in Fairfax, Va., for the Exxon Mobil Corporation; her father, J. Robert Adams, lives in East Hampton, Conn., and is the university librarian at Wesleyan University in Middletown. The bride is a stepdaughter of Pamela Adams and Emmett Ward.

The bridegroom, 34, is known as Grattan. He teaches children with learning disabilities at the Hun School in Princeton, N.J. He graduated from Wesleyan and received a master's degree in teaching reading from Harvard University. He is a son of Monica L. Baldwin of Tybee Island, Ga., and Fred Baldwin of Houston. His mother, who is retired, was a geriatric home care worker in Savannah, Ga. His father and stepmother, Wendy Watriss, run FotoFest, a biennial photography festival in Houston.
